metadata.titleEn: Fe isotope data of the Neoproterozoic Tongde intrusion in the western margin of the Yangtze Block
metadata.description: This data is the whole rock stable Fe isotope data of magmatic rocks. Samples were collected from Neoproterozoic diorite and gabbro in Tongde area, western margin of the Yangtze Block, South China. The chemical treatment of Fe isotopes was completed in the State Key Laboratory of Isotope Geochemistry, Guangzhou Institute of Geochemistry, Chinese Academy of Sciences. Total procedural blank is 25ng, and the recovery is higher than 99%. The data were analyzed by multi-collector inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry (MC-ICP-MS) with an error (2σ) less than 0.06‰. The obtained data can constrain the magma evolution process of Neoproterozoic Tongde pluton and provide new constraints for the Fe isotope fractionation mechanism of mafic-intermediate rocks.
metadata.instructions: All data are stored in Excel file. The file name "wrfe" represents the whole rock Fe isotope geochemical data.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of the Fe isotope geochemistry data collection methods for Neoproterozoic igneous rocks?
Feature Specification.Answer: sampling from Neoproterozoic diorite and gabbro intrusions, full procedure blank of 25 ng, recovery rate exceeding 99%, analytical error (2σ) of less than 0.06‰

Quantification.Question: What is the recovery rate of the chemical treatment process used in the data collection method for Fe isotope geochemistry in Neoproterozoic igneous rocks?

Interpretation.Question: What can be inferred about the geochemical evolution of the Neoproterozoic Tongde pluton from the stable Fe isotope data collected using inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry?
Interpretation.Answer: The stable Fe isotope data collected from the Neoproterozoic Tongde pluton can provide insights into the detailed evolutionary processes of the pluton. The high precision of the data, with an analytical error (2σ) below 0.06‰, allows for a refined understanding of the mechanism of Fe isotope fractionation in intermediate-mafic rocks. This could help in constraining the geochemical evolution of these rock formations and enhance understanding of the formation processes at the western margin of the South China Yangtze Block.

Causal Antecedent.Question: What factors contribute to the precision of Fe isotope geochemistry data collection in Neoproterozoic magmatic rocks from the western margin of the Yangtze Block?
Causal Antecedent.Answer: The precision of Fe isotope geochemistry data collection is influenced by several factors, including the chemical treatment process completed at the State Key Laboratory of Isotope Geochemistry in the Guangzhou Institute of Geochemistry, the quality of the full process blank which is 25ng, and the high recovery rate of over 99%. Additionally, the use of inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometry with an analytical error margin (2σ) of less than 0.06‰ plays a significant role in ensuring high precision in the data collection.

Causal Consequence.Question: What are the potential consequences on data accuracy when using chemical processing techniques with low blank values and high recovery rates in Fe isotope geochemistry?
Causal Consequence.Answer: Using chemical processing techniques with low blank values (25ng) and high recovery rates (above 99%) in Fe isotope geochemistry ensures that the data accuracy is maintained at a high level. This method minimizes contamination and maximizes the amount of isotopic signal collected, leading to precise measurements of Fe isotopes. Consequently, this enhances the reliability of conclusions drawn about the evolution of Neoproterozoic igneous bodies and the mechanisms of Fe isotope fractionation in intermediate-basic rocks.

Goal Orientation.Question: What is the objective of collecting Fe isotopic geochemical data from Neoproterozoic igneous rocks in the Tongde area of the western margin of the Yangtze block?
Goal Orientation.Answer: The objective of collecting Fe isotopic geochemical data from Neoproterozoic igneous rocks in the Tongde area is to delineate the detailed evolutionary process of the Tongde pluton and provide new constraints on the Fe isotopic fractionation mechanisms in intermediate-mafic rocks.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the specific steps and instrumental techniques used to collect and analyze Fe isotope geochemical data from Neoproterozoic igneous rocks in the western margin of the Yangtze block?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data collection involves sampling Neoproterozoic diorite and gabbro from the Tongde region in the western margin of the Yangtze block in South China. The chemical treatment of Fe isotopes is carried out at the State Key Laboratory of Isotope Geochemistry, Guangzhou Institute of Geochemistry, Chinese Academy of Sciences. The process maintains a total blank of 25 ng and achieves a recovery rate higher than 99%. The isotopic analysis is performed using an inductively coupled plasma mass spectrometer (ICP-MS), with an analytical error margin (2σ) of less than 0.06‰. This detailed process helps in constraining the evolution of the Neoproterozoic Tongde pluton and provides new insights into the Fe isotope fractionation mechanism of intermediate-basic rocks.
